title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praises the 2025 Patriots mentality of believing they can defeat any team, comparing it to past championship teams.
Head coach Mike Vrabel dismisses comparisons to past Patriots dynasties, focusing on building a successful new program with familiar foundational elements.
The revamped New England Patriots, guided by Vrabel, are preparing for Super Bowl LX with a lighter, more focused approach than before.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, pleaded guilty to forgery and identity fraud for posing as a student at Boston high schools.
Hewitt was sentenced to four years probation, must pay over $9,000 restitution, and stay away from Boston schools.
Charges included forging documents to enroll at three Boston high schools using aliases during the 2022-2023 academic year.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools pause new hiring amid a $53 million budget deficit projected for this fiscal year.
District plans to close three schools by 2027, potentially cutting 300-400 teachers and paraprofessionals.
Key contributors to the deficit are health insurance, transportation, and rising special education and food service costs.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel enlisted rookie Will Campbell to deliver humorous 'Weekend Updates' in the style of SNL.
Campbell became a fan favorite after a shirtless beer chug at a Celtics-Heat game in December.
Drake Maye praised Campbell as his top pick for a Sports Illustrated swimsuit cover among Patriots players.

title: Police searching for Dorchester girl missing since Thursday
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Police are searching for Mela Rosario, 17, last seen near Brockton courthouse after a family court appearance.
Rosario, missing from Dorchester since Jan. 29, was supposed to return home by 10 p.m. that night.
Anyone with information on Rosario is urged to contact Boston Police Department or District C-11 Detectives.

title: Devin McCourty explains ‘travesty’ following Belichick, Kraft Hall-of-Fame snubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Devin McCourty expressed confusion over the omission, calling Belichick and Kraft obvious Hall of Famers.
McCourty anticipates the Hall of Fame induction will focus on Belichick and Kraft's exclusion rather than inductees.

title: Celtics reportedly trade Anfernee Simons to Bulls, acquire Nikola Vučević
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Celtics traded Anfernee Simons and a second-round pick to the Bulls for Nikola Vučević and a second-round pick.
Nikola Vučević, a 35-year-old center, averages 16.9 points and 9.0 rebounds, bolstering the Celtics' frontcourt.
The trade reduced Boston's luxury-tax penalty from $39.5 million to $17.7 million, placing them under the first luxury-tax apron.

title: What Mike Vrabel said of Robert Kraft’s latest snub from Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel expressed disappointment after Robert Kraft wasn't voted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Robert Kraft became eligible for the Hall of Fame in 2013, but 2026 marked his first advancement past semifinals.
Patriots owner Kraft has overseen 23 playoff appearances, six Super Bowl wins, and 20 division titles since taking ownership.

title: Families of Revere women who died in Belize hotel file wrongful death lawsuit against resort, Expedia
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The families of three Revere women who died in Belize are suing Royal Kahal Beach Resort and Expedia for wrongful death.
Carbon monoxide poisoning caused the 2025 deaths of Wafae El-Arar, Kaoutar Naqqad, and Imane Mallah at Royal Kahal Beach Resort.
The lawsuit claims a malfunctioning water heater caused the deaths and alleges negligence in hotel safety measures and guest warnings.

title: She’s running Boston to raise money for Homes For Our Troops
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Rebecca Ludwig, 34, from DeKalb County, GA, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Ludwig aims to raise funds for Homes For Our Troops, supporting veterans with specially adapted homes.
Donations assist in building mortgage-free homes with features like wheelchair access and smart technology.
